triples.name: Data stream clustering
triples.relevance: The paper proposes SOHI, a novel approach for addressing the specific challenge of clustering streaming data with imbalanced cluster distributions.

triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: The paper builds on cluster analysis as the foundational technique for partitioning data into groups with similar characteristics.

triples.name: Hierarchical clustering
triples.relevance: The paper employs hierarchical merging strategy to combine neurons and organize cluster structures in a hierarchical manner.

triples.name: Self-organizing map
triples.relevance: The Self-Growth Map (SGM) is inspired by self-organizing map principles for automatic neuron arrangement based on local data distribution.

triples.name: Data mining
triples.relevance: Streaming data clustering is a core application area within data mining for discovering patterns in continuously arriving data.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper contributes to machine learning by proposing an unsupervised learning method for adaptive clustering of streaming data.

triples.name: Artificial neural network
triples.relevance: SGM uses neuron-based architecture with density-sensitive allocations, drawing from neural network principles for data representation.
